In concern of the sync issue, yes, it is really there. However, it doesn't seem to be progressively out of sync. Meaning, it's quite easy to fix (for those familiar with VirtualDub, anyhow). I reckon that putting a delay on ~200ms on the audio track makes it more enjoyable. The actual value is prolly even +/- some 10's of milliseconds more or less, you "perfectionalists" out there could prolly narrow it dows to a perfect match. However, like I said, 200ms audio delay, and this one's aaaight! =)
